content: Compose a sonnet about sunsets with exactly 70 words.

Upon the canvas of the sky, the sun descends,
A masterpiece of gold and crimson, softly blends.
The day's last breath in hues so warm, it seems to sigh,
As night ascends, with stars that twinkle, nigh.

The world below, in tranquil peace, begins to rest,
While shadows lengthen, in the light's bequest.
The ocean mirrors the sky's farewell, so grand,
Each wave a brushstroke, in nature's land.

Oh, sunset's glow, how you steal my heart away,
In your embrace, all worries fade, in golden array.
You paint the world with love, where darkness meets the light,
A moment pure, both day and night.

So here I stand, beneath your radiant grace,
Enchanted by your beauty, in this fleeting space.
